remarks: The transposition of a matrix multiplied with a scalar equals the transposed matrix multiplied with the scalar, see also the statement in [Lang] p. 505.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 17-Jul-2018.)
statement:
mattposvs.a $e |- A = ( N Mat R ) $.
mattposvs.b $e |- B = ( Base ` A ) $.
mattposvs.k $e |- K = ( Base ` R ) $.
mattposvs.v $e |- .x. = ( .s ` A ) $.
mattposvs $p |- ( ( X e. K /\ Y e. B ) -> tpos ( X .x. Y ) = ( X .x. tpos Y ) ) $.
